intro: Calandrinia capitata, commonly known as the "cape flower" or "red sand flower," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant red or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are borne in dense, terminal clusters and bloom throughout the growing season. Calandrinia capitata is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
